questions.question: Can you describe your design process from understanding user needs to delivering the final product?
questions.canonical_answer: I research user needs, create personas, sketch wireframes, build prototypes, test with users, iterate, and deliver final UI designs.

questions.question: How do you ensure your designs are both user-friendly and visually appealing?
questions.canonical_answer: I follow usability principles, keep layouts intuitive, use strong visual hierarchy, and balance aesthetics with functionality.

questions.question: Tell me about a time when user research or testing changed your initial design. What did you learn?
questions.canonical_answer: User feedback revealed usability issues, so I iterated the design to improve clarity and learned the value of early testing.

questions.question: What tools do you use for wireframing, prototyping, and design handoff â€” and why?
questions.canonical_answer: I use Figma, Sketch, or Adobe XD for collaboration, fast iteration, prototyping, and smooth design-to-development handoff.

questions.question: How do you approach designing for different devices or platforms (web, mobile, tablet)?
questions.canonical_answer: I use responsive layouts, adaptive components, platform guidelines, and test designs across breakpoints.

questions.question: How do you collaborate with developers, product managers, and stakeholders throughout a project?
questions.canonical_answer: I communicate early, share prototypes, gather feedback, clarify requirements, and ensure smooth design implementation.

questions.question: Can you explain how accessibility (a11y) influences your design decisions?
questions.canonical_answer: I ensure proper contrast, readable text, keyboard navigation, clear structure, and inclusive interactions for all users.
